result.execSummary:
The defendant Malik J Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to School District Officers, etc, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(5)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs during term of probation or civil judgment. Court WAIVES all applicable costs, fees and surcharges due to low income. If revoked, Court ordered that DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment. Cash bail applied.
- Restitution is set at $0.

- No contact with weapons. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

- No further violations of the law that rise to probable cause.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- No use or possession of illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or alcohol.
- Stay on all prescribed medications.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- Seek/maintain full time employment.
- Obtain GED, HSED or diploma.
- No Contact with Banner Prep High School or Montez E.
- Perform 50 hours of commuity service.
- Write a letter of apology to victim by 10-25-15.

timeConds.notes: With Good Time Credit; Huber for work and school. Sentence STAYED until 10-08-15 at 5pm

charges.descr: Battery to School District Officers, etc

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Malik J Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Malik J Johnson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Thomas L. Potter for Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by parties. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 years,  with credit for 7 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 years; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1.5 years.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 3 YEARS.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:
- Defendant to serve 60 in the House of Correction as a condition time sentence, with good time credit, and huber for work and school. SENTENCE STAYED UNTIL 10-08-2015 at 5:00 pm.
- No further violations of the law that rise to probable cause.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.  
- No use or possession of illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or alcohol.
- Stay on all prescribed medications.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or  treatment deemed appropriate.
- Seek/maintain full time employment.  
- Obtain GED, HSED or diploma.
- No contact with Banner Prep High School or Montez E.
- No contact with weapons.
- Perform 50 hours of community service. 
- Write letter of apology to victim by 10-25-2015.
- Court WAIVES all applicable costs, fees and surcharges due to low income. 
- Restitution is set at $0.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs during term of probation or civil judgment.  

If revoked, the Court ordered that DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

filed: Written Explanatio nof Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right Seek Postconviction Relief, Sentencing Referral Form
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Case recalled.  Appearances remain the same.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and elements received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court informs the defendant that as a convicted felon he is not allowed to carry any firearms or body armour and his voting rights are restricted until they are restored.  Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Malik J Johnson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Case called and passed to allow defense more time.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

15RM033848  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07/16/2015

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Malik J Johnson not in court, in custody.  Patrick Anderson for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.   All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Malik J Johnson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Malik J Johnson in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BANNER PREPARATORY SCHOOL, 5460 N 64TH ST., ERVIN M., AYANA G., AND JASON B.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Malik J Johnson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Malik J Johnson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
